MemberSignature.Value: public static Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.ModelBuilder HasDatabaseMaxSize (this Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.ModelBuilder modelBuilder, string maxSize);
.method public static hidebysig class Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.ModelBuilder HasDatabaseMaxSize(class Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.ModelBuilder modelBuilder, string maxSize) cil managed
<Extension()> Public Function HasDatabaseMaxSize (modelBuilder As ModelBuilder, maxSize As String) As ModelBuilder
static member HasDatabaseMaxSize : Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.ModelBuilder * string -> Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.ModelBuilder

Docs.param: The maximum size of the database.

summary.para: Configures the maximum size for Azure SQL Database.
Units must be included, e.g. "100 MB". See Azure SQL Database documentation for all supported values.

Docs.returns: The same builder instance so that multiple calls can be chained.
Docs.remarks: See Modeling entity types and relationships, and Accessing SQL Server and SQL Azure databases with EF Core for more information.

Docs.param: The maximum size of the database.
Indicates whether the configuration was specified using a data annotation.

summary.para: Attempts to configure the maximum size for Azure SQL Database.
Units must be included, e.g. "100 MB". See Azure SQL Database documentation for all supported values.

Docs.returns: The same builder instance if the configuration was applied, otherwise.
Docs.remarks: See Modeling entity types and relationships, and Accessing SQL Server and SQL Azure databases with EF Core for more information.

Docs.param: The value that is used for the very first row loaded into the table.
The incremental value that is added to the identity value of the previous row that was loaded.
Docs.summary: Configures the model to use the SQL Server IDENTITY feature to generate values for key properties marked as , when targeting SQL Server. This is the default behavior when targeting SQL Server.
Docs.returns: The same builder instance so that multiple calls can be chained.
Docs.remarks: See Modeling entity types and relationships, and Accessing SQL Server and SQL Azure databases with EF Core for more information.
